name: lushness
content:
lushness noun [U]
(OF PLANTS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of having a lot of green, healthy plants, grass, and trees: He created a garden of tropical lushness. Tourists love the lushness of the rolling green hills.
More examplesFewer examplesThe lushness of the vegetation was obvious in sunlight.We relaxed in the green, cool lushness of the garden.The fields and forests have a lushness that almost resembles that of a tropical climate.

lushness noun [U]
(BEAUTY)
the quality of being very attractive to look at, taste, smell, etc.: The café has old-fashioned atmosphere and lushness. The second viola lends lushness to the quintet. See
lush
More examplesFewer examplesThere is restraint to the film, alongside its visual lushness.The band achieved a rhythmic drive and lushness of sound that one doesn't often encounter from jazz trios today.The dance had a sweet, sharp, quirky lushness.
